org.dima.dominikschroeck.largestate.functions.NexMark

Class Query5_Auction_to_Item_CoProcessFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.AbstractRichFunction
      • org.apache.flink.streaming.api.functions.co.CoProcessFunction<org.dima.dominikschroeck.largestate.Events.NexMark.BidEvent,org.dima.dominikschroeck.largestate.Events.NexMark.AuctionEvent,org.apache.flink.api.java.tuple.Tuple3<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Long>>
        • org.dima.dominikschroeck.largestate.functions.NexMark.Query5_Auction_to_Item_CoProcessFunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.Function, org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.RichFunction

    public class Query5_Auction_to_Item_CoProcessFunction
extends org.apache.flink.streaming.api.functions.co.CoProcessFunction<org.dima.dominikschroeck.largestate.Events.NexMark.BidEvent,org.dima.dominikschroeck.largestate.Events.NexMark.AuctionEvent,org.apache.flink.api.java.tuple.Tuple3<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Long>>
    This CoFlatMap operator takes auctions and bids as input and stores a list of auction id's, their corresponding item id's and the auctions' end date. A maintenance function removes all expired auctions This function outputs every item id that a bid was given on. We have to connect with auctions as a bid does not know which item it bids on, only the auctio
    See Also:

        Incoming auction. In a perfect world, we only receive one because we expect a keyed stream, keyed by auction ID's. And only one auction should be opened with the same ID This method does not emit any event, just updates the respective valueState
